title: Associate Director (C#, Full stack and AWS)
description:
**About the Role:**  

**Grade Level (for internal use):** 12
  
  

**The Team:**  

The Enterprise Solutions Technology division includes workflow solutions across Lending, Reg \& Compliance, Global Markets and Software business. Enterprise Solutions provides industry\-leading set of integrated tools, solutions and data services that help our clients make efficient investment decisions, operate with greater efficiency, and provide transparency across their business and to their key stakeholders.
  
  

**What’s in it for you:**  

This is the place to utilize your existing software development skills while having the chance to become exposed to the latest cutting\-edge technologies available in the market. Alongside you get opportunities to:
  
* Mentor and work with a skilled team while shaping the future of our products.
* Working on the latest technologies at scale .
* Build, develop, and guide high\-performing talent to guide their growth path
* Expand experience with modern cutting\-edge technologies like Dev Ops, and cloud technologies.
* Willingness to learn \& master new technologies. We are looking for cross\-team members, for versatile Full Stack experience.


We are seeking a highly skilled and experienced Senior Architect/Lead specializing in C\#, React and AWS to join our dynamic team. As a Senior Architect, you will play a crucial role in designing and implementing scalable, reliable, and secure cloud\-based applications using AWS services, with a primary focus on C\# and React development.
  
  

**Key Responsibilities:**  

Architect and design complex software solutions utilizing C\#, React and AWS cloud services.
  
Evangelize AI\-enabled development with Copilot, Claude, Cursor
  
**Build a design\-first engineering culture:** ideation, validation, iteration
  
Oversee delivery excellence and cross\-functional collaboration
  
Implement AI/ML models and GenAI use cases into production systems
  
Coach leads on system architecture, Vibe Coding, and innovation
  
Lead technical discussions with stakeholders to understand requirements and propose scalable architecture designs.
  
Develop proof\-of\-concepts and prototypes to validate technical feasibility and business value.
  
Collaborate with cross\-functional teams (developers, product managers, etc.) to deliver robust solutions aligned with business objectives.
  
Conduct code reviews and provide technical guidance and mentorship to junior team members.
  
Implement best practices for cloud security, monitoring, and performance optimization within AWS environments.
  
Continuously evaluate and recommend new technologies and methodologies to improve system architecture and development processes.
  
Ensure adherence to coding standards, documentation, and quality measures in software development.
  
  

**Required Skills and Qualifications:**  

Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field; Master’s degree preferred.
  
13–17 years of tech and delivery leadership
  
Proficient in Python, Java, and AI/ML frameworks (TensorFlow, LangChain)
  
Hands\-on use of design thinking tools (Miro, Figma, etc.)
  
Demonstrated use of GenAI tools in production workflows
  
Experience with microservices, DevOps, and container platforms
  
Proven experience (3\+ years) as a Senior Architect or similar role focusing on C\# development, React and AWS cloud services.
  
Strong proficiency in C\# programming language and .NET framework.
  
Extensive hands\-on experience with AWS services such as EC2, ECS, SQS, SNS, Lambda, S3, RDS, SQL, etc.
  
Solid understanding of microservices architecture and containerization (Docker, Kubernetes) and Single Page Application (SPA)/Micro front\-end Architecture.
  
Expertise in designing and optimizing relational databases.
  
Experience with CI/CD pipelines and automated deployment tools (e.g., Jenkins, GitLab CI/CD, Octopus, ADO).
  
Excellent analytical and problem\-solving skills, with a keen attention to detail.
  
Strong leadership and communication abilities, with a proven track record of mentoring and guiding development teams.
  
  

**Preferred Qualifications:**  

AWS certification (e.g., AWS Certified Solutions Architect) is a plus.
  
Experience with other programming languages (e.g., Python, React) is advantageous.
  
Familiarity with serverless computing and event\-driven architectures.
  
  

**Benefits:**  

Competitive salary and performance\-based bonuses.
  
Comprehensive benefits package including health insurance, retirement plans, and wellness programs.
  
Opportunities for professional development and training.
  
Flexible work hours and remote work options.
  
  

About S\&P Global Market Intelligence
  
  

At S\&P Global Market Intelligence, a division of S\&P Global we understand the importance of accurate, deep and insightful information. Our team of experts delivers unrivaled insights and leading data and technology solutions, partnering with customers to expand their perspective, operate with confidence, and make decisions with conviction.
  
  

For more information, visit www.spglobal.com/marketintelligence .
  
  

What’s In It For You?
  
  

**Our Mission:**  

Advancing Essential Intelligence.
  
  

**Our People:**  

We're more than 35,000 strong worldwide—so we're able to understand nuances while having a broad perspective. Our team is driven by curiosity and a shared belief that Essential Intelligence can help build a more prosperous future for us all.From finding new ways to measure sustainability to analyzing energy transition across the supply chain to building workflow solutions that make it easy to tap into insight and apply it. We are changing the way people see things and empowering them to make an impact on the world we live in. We’re committed to a more equitable future and to helping our customers find new, sustainable ways of doing business. Join us and help create the critical insights that truly make a difference.
  
  

**Our Values:**  

Integrity, Discovery, Partnership
  
  

Throughout our history, the world's leading organizations have relied on us for the Essential Intelligence they need to make confident decisions about the road ahead. We start with a foundation of integrity in all we do, bring a spirit of discovery to our work, and collaborate in close partnership with each other and our customers to achieve shared goals.
  
  

**Benefits:**  

We take care of you, so you can take care of business. We care about our people. That’s why we provide everything you—and your career—need to thrive at S\&P Global.
  
  

**Our benefits include:**  

**Health \& Wellness:** Health care coverage designed for the mind and body.
  
  

**Flexible Downtime:** Generous time off helps keep you energized for your time on.
  
  

**Continuous Learning:** Access a wealth of resources to grow your career and learn valuable new skills.
  
  

**Invest in Your Future:** Secure your financial future through competitive pay, retirement planning, a continuing education program with a company\-matched student loan contribution, and financial wellness programs.
  
  

**Family Friendly Perks:** It’s not just about you. S\&P Global has perks for your partners and little ones, too, with some best\-in class benefits for families.
  
  

**Beyond the Basics:** From retail discounts to referral incentive awards—small perks can make a big difference.
  
**For more information on benefits by country visit:** https://spgbenefits.com/benefit\-summaries
  
  

**Global Hiring and Opportunity at S\&P Global:**  

At S\&P Global, we are committed to fostering a connected and engaged workplace where all individuals have access to opportunities based on their skills, experience, and contributions. Our hiring practices emphasize fairness, transparency, and merit, ensuring that we attract and retain top talent. By valuing different perspectives and promoting a culture of respect and collaboration, we drive innovation and power global markets.
  
  

**Recruitment Fraud Alert:**  

If you receive an email from a spglobalind.com domain or any other regionally based domains, it is a scam and should be reported to reportfraud@spglobal.com . S\&P Global never requires any candidate to pay money for job applications, interviews, offer letters, “pre\-employment training” or for equipment/delivery of equipment. Stay informed and protect yourself from recruitment fraud by reviewing our guidelines, fraudulent domains, and how to report suspicious activity here .

title: Regional People Advisor
description:
**About the Role:**  

**Grade Level (for internal use):** 12
  
  

**The Team:**  

Join a best\-in\-class global People team, working collaboratively across regions to deliver high\-quality employee and business support. Our team values a global mindset, diverse perspectives, and a commitment to excellence—leveraging insights across countries to enhance our People practices, operational consistency, and employee experience.
  
  

**Responsibilities and Impact:**  

As a Regional People Advisor, you will directly influence employee engagement, manager capability, compliance outcomes, and day\-to\-day People operations . You will collaborate with HRBPs, COEs, Analytics, and external consultants to deliver People solutions that align global priorities with local realities. Your work will shape employee experiences, ensure consistent application of People practices, and provide leaders with the insights and guidance needed to support their teams effectively.
  
  

Advisory Responsibilities (\~60%)
  
  

**People \& Policy Guidance:** Provide support on regional employment laws, benefits, leave requirements, and compliance expectations.
  
  

**Manager Support:** Advise managers on performance management, feedback, employee relations, and People best practices.
  
  

**Employee Relations:** Handle Tier 1/Tier 2 ER matters, conducting documentation, investigations, and early interventions where appropriate.
  
  

**Talent \& Development Support:** Identify local development needs and assist COEs in deploying appropriate learning initiatives.
  
  

**People Initiative Support:** Contribute local insights to global People initiatives, adapting delivery to meet regional needs.
  
  

**Workforce Insights:** Partner with People Analytics to interpret regional data trends and support forecasting and planning.
  
  

**Engagement \& Culture:** Support regional engagement activities and help reinforce a high\-performance, inclusive culture.
  
  

Operational Execution — 40%
  
  

**Employee Lifecycle Coordination:** Manage onboarding, job changes, promotions, transfers, and separation processes.
  
  

**Leave Administration:** Administer statutory and company leave programs, ensuring compliance and timely communication.
  
  

**Benefits Support:** Partner with benefits teams to resolve regional benefits queries and support enrollment processes.
  
  

**Payroll Coordination:** Collaborate with Global Payroll to ensure timely and accurate payroll processing and issue resolution.
  
  

**Compliance \& Documentation:** Maintain accurate records, ensure statutory compliance, and support audit and reporting needs.
  
  

**Process \& Workflow Optimization:** Identify opportunities to streamline processes through automation, technology, and AI\-enabled tools.
  
  

**Knowledge \& Policy Management:** Maintain regional policies, procedures, and knowledge articles in alignment with Shared Services and COEs.
  
  

**What We’re Looking For:**  

Required Qualifications
  
  

Bachelor's degree required.
  
  

5 \+ years of progressive HR/People experience with a strong generalist or advisory foundation.
  
  

Strong knowledge of local employment laws, labor regulations, and HR compliance.
  
  

Experience supporting performance management cycles, coaching leaders, and navigating ER matters.
  
  

Excellent communication skills with the ability to build trusted relationships at all levels.
  
  

Ability to interpret People data, identify trends, and translate insights into practical actions.
  
  

Demonstrated capability to resolve complex, sensitive People issues with sound judgment.
  
  

Cultural fluency and ability to tailor People practices to meet local expectations.
  
  

Bachelor’s degree in HR, Business, or related field preferred.
  
  

Business fluency in English and the required local language(s) for the region
  
  

Preferred Qualifications
  
  

Experience working with employment laws in multiple countries within the region.
  
  

Familiarity with works council processes and regulatory environments (where applicable).
  
  

Experience in HR operations, service delivery, or Shared Services environments.
  
  

Comfort operating in a fast\-paced, transformation\-focused environment with a roll\-up\-your\-sleeves mentality.
  
  

About S\&P Global Mobility
  
At S\&P Global Mobility, we provide invaluable insights derived from unmatched automotive data, enabling our customers to anticipate change and make decisions with conviction. Our expertise helps them to optimize their businesses, reach the right consumers, and shape the future of mobility. We open the door to automotive innovation, revealing the buying patterns of today and helping customers plan for the emerging technologies of tomorrow.
  
For more information, visit www.spglobal.com/mobility .
  
  

What’s In It For You?
  
  

**Our Mission:**  

Advancing Essential Intelligence.
  
  

**Our People:**  

We're more than 35,000 strong worldwide—so we're able to understand nuances while having a broad perspective. Our team is driven by curiosity and a shared belief that Essential Intelligence can help build a more prosperous future for us all.From finding new ways to measure sustainability to analyzing energy transition across the supply chain to building workflow solutions that make it easy to tap into insight and apply it. We are changing the way people see things and empowering them to make an impact on the world we live in. We’re committed to a more equitable future and to helping our customers find new, sustainable ways of doing business. Join us and help create the critical insights that truly make a difference.
  
  

**Our Values:**  

Integrity, Discovery, Partnership
  
  

Throughout our history, the world's leading organizations have relied on us for the Essential Intelligence they need to make confident decisions about the road ahead. We start with a foundation of integrity in all we do, bring a spirit of discovery to our work, and collaborate in close partnership with each other and our customers to achieve shared goals.
  
  

**Benefits:**  

We take care of you, so you can take care of business. We care about our people. That’s why we provide everything you—and your career—need to thrive at S\&P Global.
  
  

**Our benefits include:**  

**Health \& Wellness:** Health care coverage designed for the mind and body.
  
  

**Flexible Downtime:** Generous time off helps keep you energized for your time on.
  
  

**Continuous Learning:** Access a wealth of resources to grow your career and learn valuable new skills.
  
  

**Invest in Your Future:** Secure your financial future through competitive pay, retirement planning, a continuing education program with a company\-matched student loan contribution, and financial wellness programs.
  
  

**Family Friendly Perks:** It’s not just about you. S\&P Global has perks for your partners and little ones, too, with some best\-in class benefits for families.
  
  

**Beyond the Basics:** From retail discounts to referral incentive awards—small perks can make a big difference.
  
**For more information on benefits by country visit:** https://spgbenefits.com/benefit\-summaries
  
  

**Global Hiring and Opportunity at S\&P Global:**  

At S\&P Global, we are committed to fostering a connected and engaged workplace where all individuals have access to opportunities based on their skills, experience, and contributions. Our hiring practices emphasize fairness, transparency, and merit, ensuring that we attract and retain top talent. By valuing different perspectives and promoting a culture of respect and collaboration, we drive innovation and power global markets.
  
  

**Recruitment Fraud Alert:**  

If you receive an email from a spglobalind.com domain or any other regionally based domains, it is a scam and should be reported to reportfraud@spglobal.com . S\&P Global never requires any candidate to pay money for job applications, interviews, offer letters, “pre\-employment training” or for equipment/delivery of equipment. Stay informed and protect yourself from recruitment fraud by reviewing our guidelines, fraudulent domains, and how to report suspicious activity here .

S\&P Global is an equal opportunity employer and all qualified candidates will receive consideration for employment without regard to race/ethnicity, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, marital status, military veteran status, unemployment status, or any other status protected by law. Only electronic job submissions will be considered for employment.
  
  

If you need an accommodation during the application process due to a disability, please send an email to: EEO.Compliance@spglobal.com and your request will be forwarded to the appropriate person.
  
  

**US Candidates Only:** The EEO is the Law Poster http://www.dol.gov/ofccp/regs/compliance/posters/pdf/eeopost.pdf describes discrimination protections under federal law. title: Senior Technical Marketing Engineer – Service Provider
description:
Senior Technical Marketing Engineer – Service Provider  



This role has been designed as ‘’Onsite’ with an expectation that you will primarily work from an HPE office.**Who We Are:**


Hewlett Packard Enterprise is the global edge\-to\-cloud company advancing the way people live and work. We help companies connect, protect, analyze, and act on their data and applications wherever they live, from edge to cloud, so they can turn insights into outcomes at the speed required to thrive in today’s complex world. Our culture thrives on finding new and better ways to accelerate what’s next. We know varied backgrounds are valued and succeed here. We have the flexibility to manage our work and personal needs. We make bold moves, together, and are a force for good. If you are looking to stretch and grow your career our culture will embrace you. Open up opportunities with HPE.

**Job Description:**

  



**What you'll do:**

**About the Position**


HPE Juniper Networking is seeking a senior, passionate, and highly motivated Senior Technical Marketing Engineer to drive and own technical marketing activities with an emphasis on Service Provider—5G xHaul, Cloud Metro, Broadband Edge, and Telco markets, and to be a primary contributor to HPE Juniper Service Provider and AI\-era architectures.


This individual will be part of HPE Juniper’s TME and PLM organization and a strategic partner to go\-to\-market and R\&D engineering teams to define, advocate for, and drive the evolution of the product portfolio, including new solutions for AI workloads and Service Provider AI architectures (e.g., AI/ML training and inference fabrics, AI\-ready transport, and edge AI services) and cloud\-delivered services.


This role is a key senior individual contributor position that requires leadership across cross\-functional teams—engineering, QA/test, product management, marketing, sales, and systems engineering—to execute against HPE Juniper’s growth strategy in the AI and Cloud Metro era.

**Responsibilities**


The ideal candidate is execution\-oriented, has a builder mentality, strong technical acumen, and is comfortable spanning deep technology and customer\-facing business conversations. Essential responsibilities include:

* Act as technical advisor and go\-to subject matter expert for targeted platforms and solutions; help product teams drive Service Provider, AI\-ready transport, and xHaul platform strategy, product definition, and program execution.
* Develop a coherent solution story focused on:
	+ 5G (and emerging 6G\-ready) xHaul and Open RAN/Cloud RAN transport
	+ Cloud Metro and Broadband Edge architectures
	+ Cable DAA, FWA, and converged IP service edge
	+ Service Provider AI architectures and AI\-centric use cases, including AI data center interconnect, AI/ML clusters, and distributed inference/edge AI.
* Communicate value propositions, architectures, and implementation details to customers and internal sales organizations by:
	+ Developing technical collateral (white papers, solution briefs, reference designs, validated designs)
	+ Delivering live webinars, conference sessions, and technical demos
	+ Contributing content to blogs, videos, and Git/GitHub\-hosted assets (lab guides, code samples, configs).
* Design and implement compelling Proof of Concept (PoC) lab setups and demos for SP and Cloud Metro / AI solutions, including:
	+ Segment Routing (SR\-MPLS and/or SRv6\) and SR\-TE/SR Policies
	+ Advanced EVPN services (e.g., EVPN\-VPWS/ELAN/ETREE, L3VPN)
	+ Traffic engineering and fast reroute (e.g., TI\-LFA)
	+ Integration with automation frameworks and CI/CD.  
	
	Document results clearly and maintain demos so they are reproducible by sales and SE teams.
* Drive network automation and telemetry blueprints, including:
	+ Design of workflows using NETCONF/gNMI, YANG models, REST/JSON APIs, Ansible, Terraform, Python, and/or controller platforms (e.g., Routing Director or similar).
	+ Definition and validation of streaming telemetry and observability architectures (gNMI, model\-driven telemetry, Kafka/data\-lake ingestion, dashboards, closed\-loop automation).
* Translate AI workload requirements into transport and metro network architectures, including capacity planning, latency/jitter constraints, traffic engineering (segment routing/SRv6 policies), QoS, and multi\-tenant isolation.
* Produce competitive analysis collateral that highlights HPE Junipers’ strengths and areas for improvement (features, scale, performance, TCO, operational model) and keep it current with market evolution.
* Evangelize HPE Juniper’s vision for network transformation in the AI and 5G era by:
	+ Participating in external events (conferences, forums, webinars)
	+ Contributing to industry standards bodies and ecosystem partnerships where appropriate.
* Proactively identify gaps in product and solution roadmaps by continually validating against real customer use cases and deployments—spanning Cloud Metro, AI\-centric transport, broadband, and xHaul.
* Work closely with sales, SEs, and regional architects to gather requirements, prioritize them, and drive commitments with engineering organizations.
* Generate sales and product collateral (presentations, battlecards, solution briefs, validated design documents) tailored to different audience levels (executive, architectural, operational).
* Collaborate with marketing to develop and execute go\-to\-market strategies and launch plans for new platforms and solutions, including AI\-related and automation\-centric offers.
* Participate in RFP/RFI responses and defenses, contribute to reusable technical boilerplates and configuration templates that accelerate future responses.
* Build and expand relationships with service provider, cloud, and AI/edge customers, serving as a trusted technical advisor and feedback channel back into engineering and PLM.

**What you need to bring:**

**Minimum Qualifications**

**Preferred Qualifications**

* Advanced degree in Engineering and/or an MBA.
* Expert\-level industry certification such as JNCIE, CCIE, or equivalent.
* Experience contributing to standards bodies (IETF, MEF, TIP, ORAN, etc.) or multi\-vendor interoperability events.


This role requires the ability to build and drive deep\-dive technical solution blueprints and network architectures and to be a subject matter expert in key areas of Service Provider networking. The ideal candidate thinks strategically, crosses technical and marketing domains fluidly, and can distill complex concepts into practical implementation guidance.


Qualifications include:

* BS/MS in Computer Science, Electrical/Computer Engineering, or related field.
* 10\+ years of experience in the Service Provider market, focused on IP routing and switching, including large\-scale backbone, metro, or broadband networks.
* 3\+ years of experience in Technical Marketing, Consulting/Systems Engineering, or architecture roles for Service Providers and/or Cloud Providers.
* Exposure to at least one major Service Provider domain such as:
	+ Cloud Metro or Metro Ethernet
	+ Mobile/xHaul and Open RAN/Cloud RAN transport
	+ SP WAN Core and Edge
	+ Broadband Edge and aggregation
	+ AI/ML and data\-intensive workloads (DCI for AI clusters, GPU fabrics, or edge inference backhaul).
* Excellent knowledge of routing and switching protocols and SP architectures, including but not limited to:
	+ IP/MPLS, Segment Routing (SR\-MPLS and/or SRv6\)
	+ L3VPN, EVPN (EVPN\-VPWS, EVPN\-ELAN/ETREE, EVPN\-L3\)
	+ Traffic Engineering (SR\-TE Policies, RSVP\-TE), fast reroute, QoS
	+ OAM and service assurance mechanisms.
* Knowledge of carrier\-class hardware and software architectures for routers and switches (line cards, fabric, scale and resiliency considerations, control vs. data plane separation).
* Hands\-on experience with at least one major vendor’s SP portfolio (HPE Juniper, Cisco, Nokia, Arista, etc.). Experience with JUNOS and HPE Juniper WAN/Routing Director portfolios is a strong plus.
* Proven track record of developing end\-to\-end network solutions and reference architectures for complex Service Provider networks, including lab validation and documentation.
* Experience with network automation and programmability, such as:
	+ NETCONF/gNMI, YANG models
	+ Ansible, Terraform, Python scripting, CI/CD pipelines
	+ Controller\-based architectures (e.g., Routing Director or equivalent).
* Experience with telemetry and observability, such as:
	+ Streaming telemetry (gNMI/model\-driven)
	+ Export to time\-series / observability stacks (e.g., Prometheus, InfluxDB, Kafka, data lakes)
	+ Integration with NMS/OSS and closed\-loop automation systems.
* Familiarity with AI\-adjacent and cloud\-native architectures, such as:
	+ Data center and AI fabrics, DCI for accelerator/GPU clusters
	+ Container networking and Kubernetes (CNI, CNFs)
	+ Multi\-cloud and interconnect architectures.
* Ability to perform thorough technical and architectural analyses of competitor products/solutions, and to translate that into clear positioning and guidance.
* Ability to articulate the value proposition of a product or solution in both business and technical terms, tailored to executives, architects, and operators.
* Excellent communication and presentation skills, including the ability to present at industry conferences, customer workshops, and internal enablement sessions.
* Curious about technical details, self\-driven learner, and comfortable working in fast\-moving technology domains (AI, automation, SRv6, Cloud Metro).

**Additional Skills:**


Cloud Architectures, Cross Domain Knowledge, Design Thinking, Development Fundamentals, DevOps, Distributed Computing, Microservices Fluency, Full Stack Development, Security\-First Mindset, User Experience (UX)**What We Can Offer You:**

**Health \& Wellbeing**


We strive to provide our team members and their loved ones with a comprehensive suite of benefits that supports their physical, financial and emotional wellbeing.

**Personal \& Professional Development**


We also invest in your career because the better you are, the better we all are. We have specific programs catered to helping you reach any career goals you have — whether you want to become a knowledge expert in your field or apply your skills to another division.

**Unconditional Inclusion**


We are unconditionally inclusive in the way we work and celebrate individual uniqueness. We know varied backgrounds are valued and succeed here. We have the flexibility to manage our work and personal needs. We make bold moves, together, and are a force for good.

**Let's Stay Connected:**


Follow @HPECareers on Instagram to see the latest on people, culture and tech at HPE.


\#india
\#networking**Job:**


Engineering**Job Level:**


TCP\_04  



HPE is an Equal Employment Opportunity/ Veterans/Disabled/LGBT employer. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, gender, or any other protected category, and all decisions we make are made on the basis of qualifications, merit, and business need. Our goal is to be one global team that is representative of our customers, in an inclusive environment where we can continue to innovate and grow together. Please click here: Equal Employment Opportunity.

**Hewlett Packard Enterprise is EEO Protected Veteran/ Individual with Disabilities.**

  



HPE will comply with all applicable laws related to employer use of arrest and conviction records, including laws requiring employers to consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories.

  



**No Fees Notice \& Recruitment Fraud Disclaimer**

 *It has come to HPE’s attention that there has been an increase in recruitment fraud whereby scammer impersonate HPE or HPE\-authorized recruiting agencies and offer fake employment opportunities to candidates. These scammers often seek to obtain personal information or money from candidates.*

 *Please note that Hewlett Packard Enterprise (HPE), its direct and indirect subsidiaries and affiliated companies, and its authorized recruitment* *agencies/vendors* ***will never charge any candidate a registration fee, hiring fee, or any other fee in connection with its recruitment and hiring process.*** *The credentials of any hiring agency that claims to be working with HPE for recruitment of talent should be verified by candidates and candidates shall be solely responsible to conduct such verification. Any candidate/individual who relies on the erroneous representations made by fraudulent employment agencies does so at their own risk, and HPE disclaims liability for any damages or claims that may result from any such communication.*

title: AI/ML Engineer (Python Programming)
description:
At **Citi** we’re not just building technology, we’re building the future of banking. Encompassing a broad range of specialties, roles, and cultures, our teams are creating innovations used across the globe. Citi is constantly growing and progressing through our technology, with laser focused on evolving the ways of doing things. As one of the world’s most global banks we’re changing how the world does business

**Shape your Career with Citi**


We’re currently looking for a high caliber professional to join our team as **Officer, AI/ML Engineer (Python Programming)\- Hybrid** (Internal Job Title: **25924787** AI/ML Engineer\- C11\) based in Pune, India. Being part of our team means that we’ll provide you with the resources to meet your unique needs, empower you to make healthy decision and manage your financial well\-being to help plan for your future. For instance:

* We provide programs and services for your physical and mental well\-being including access to telehealth options, health advocates, confidential counseling and more. Coverage varies by country.
* We empower our employees to manage their financial well\-being and help them plan for the future.
* We provide access to an array of learning and development resources to help broaden and deepen your skills and knowledge as your career progresses.

**In this role, you’re expected to:**

* Utilize knowledge of applications development procedures and concepts, and basic knowledge of other technical areas to identify and define necessary system enhancements, including using script tools and analyzing/interpreting code.
* Consult with users, clients, and other technology groups on issues, and recommend programming solutions, install, and support customer exposure systems
* Apply fundamental knowledge of programming languages for design specifications.
* Analyze applications to identify vulnerabilities and security issues, as well as conduct testing and debugging
* Serve as advisor or coach to new or lower level analysts

**As a successful candidate, you’d ideally have the following skills and exposure:**

* **4\-8 years** of experience working as AI/ML Engineer or Developer.
* Excellent Proficiency in **Python Software Development**, following Object\-Oriented design patterns and best practices.
* Experience in using **Machine Learning/Deep Learning**: XGBoost, LightGBM, TensorFlow, PyTorch.
* Strong hands\-on experience in Machine Learning, delivering complex solutions to production.
* Experience with **Generative AI technologies essential**.
* Knowledge of **NLP,** Name Entity Recognition
* In\-depth knowledge of deep learning and Generative AI frameworks such as, Langchain, Lang Graph, Crew AI or similar.

title: Data Analytics Analyst
description:
The Data Analytics Intmd Analyst is a developing professional role. Deals with most problems independently and has some latitude to solve complex problems. Integrates in\-depth specialty area knowledge with a solid understanding of industry standards and practices. Good understanding of how the team and area integrate with others in accomplishing the objectives of the subfunction/ job family. Applies analytical thinking and knowledge of data analysis tools and methodologies. Requires attention to detail when making judgments and recommendations based on the analysis of factual information. Typically deals with variable issues with potentially broader business impact. Applies professional judgment when interpreting data and results. Breaks down information in a systematic and communicable manner. Developed communication and diplomacy skills are required in order to exchange potentially complex/sensitive information. Moderate but direct impact through close contact with the businesses' core activities. Quality and timeliness of service provided will affect the effectiveness of own team and other closely related teams.  

  

**Responsibilities:**

* Integrates in\-depth data analysis knowledge with a solid understanding of industry standards and practices.
* Demonstrates a Good understanding of how data analytics teams and area integrate with others in accomplishing objectives.
* Applies project management skills.
* Applies analytical thinking and knowledge of data analysis tools and methodologies.
* Analyzes factual information to make accurate judgments and recommendations focused on local operations and broader impacts.
* Applies professional judgment when interpreting data and results breaking down information in a systematic and communicable manner.
* Employs developed communication and diplomacy skills to exchange potentially complex/sensitive information.
* Demonstrates attention to quality and timeliness of service to ensure the effectiveness of the team and group.
* Provides informal guidance or on\-the\-job\-training to new team members.
* Appropriately assess risk when business decisions are made, demonstrating particular consideration for the firm's reputation and safeguarding Citigroup, its clients and assets, by driving compliance with applicable laws, rules and regulations, adhering to Policy, applying sound ethical judgment regarding personal behavior, conduct and business practices, and escalating, managing and reporting control issues with transparency.

 **Qualifications:**

* 5\-8 years relevant experience
* Knowledge of tools for statistical modeling of large data sets
* Ability to effectively use complex analytical, interpretive and problem solving techniques
* Demonstrated interpersonal, verbal and written communication skills

 **Education:**

* Bachelor’s/University degree or equivalent experience

  

This job description provides a high\-level review of the types of work performed. Other job\-related duties may be assigned as required.

title: Manager – Data & Process Management
description:
**Job title**: Manager – Data \& Process Management

* **Hiring Manager**: Team Lead – Data \& Process Management
* **Location**: Hyderabad/Mumbai
* **% of travel expected**: Travel required as per business need if any
* **Job type**: Permanent and Full time

 **About the job**

**Our Team:**


Sanofi Business Operation (SBO) is an internal Sanofi resource organization based in India and is setup to centralize processes and activities to support Specialty Care, Vaccines, General Medicines, CHC, CMO, and R\&D, Data \& Digital functions. SBO strives to be a strategic and functional partner for tactical deliveries to Medical, HEVA, and Commercial organizations in Sanofi, globally.

 **Main responsibilities:**


The overall purpose and main responsibilities are listed below:

* Collaborate with Data Scientists and other commercial business stake holders in developing fit for purpose datasets.
* Comprehensive subject matter expertise on Sanofi’s data echo system data assets
* SME level contributions to data quality management.
* Address business questions/issues via data inquiries and data investigations.
* Create ad hoc/ongoing custom datasets based on business needs.
* Create and manage the commercial data catalogue.


People:


* Maintain effective relationship with the end stakeholders within the allocated GBU and tasks – with an end objective to develop education and communication content as per requirement. Actively


lead and develop SBO operations associates and ensure new technologies are leveraged. Initiate


the contracting process and related documents within defined timelines Collaborate


with global stakeholders for project planning and setting up the timelines and maintaining budget. Lead


, mentor, and manage a team of analysts, data engineers, and data stewards. Provide


guidance on complex data challenges and oversee team deliverables. Foster


a culture of collaboration, innovation, and continuous learning within the team. Partner


with departments such as Finance, Operations, Marketing, and IT to understand data needs and provide solutions. Act


as a key liaison between technical teams and business stakeholders. Communicate


complex data findings clearly to non\-technical audiences.


Performance:

* Refresh Existing Reports and identifies improvement opportunities in reporting and BI tools and as needed structure / functionality with the latest insights as they become available.
* Create dashboards to synthesize and visualize key information and enable business decisions.
* Works to develop deal tracking analytics and reporting capabilities.
* Collaborates with Digital to enhance data access across various sources, develop tools, technology, and process to constantly improve quality and productivity.
* Drive the use of advanced analytics and reporting to support strategic decision\-making.
* Collaborate with business leaders to identify key metrics and develop dashboards.
* Monitor trends, patterns, and anomalies in data to uncover actionable insights.


Process:

* Support delivery of projects in terms of resourcing, coordination, quality, timeliness, efficiency, and high technical standards for deliveries made by the medical/ field writing group, including scientific documents and clinical/medical reports.
* Contribute to overall quality enhancement by ensuring high scientific standards for the output produced by the medical/ field writing group; and
* Secure adherence to compliance procedures and internal/operational risk controls in accordance with all applicable standards
* Identify inefficiencies in current data workflows and implement process improvements.
* Lead the adoption of new tools and technologies to enhance data management capabilities.
* Drive automation of data processes to reduce manual intervention and improve accuracy.


Stakeholder:

* Work closely with global teams and/ external vendors to ensure the end\-to\-end effective project delivery of the designated publication/medical education deliverables

**About you**

**Experience**:

* 7\+ years of experience in pharmaceutical product commercial omni channel datasets, data governance and data stewardship. In\-depth knowledge of common databases like IQVIA, APLD, SFMC, Google analytics, Engagement, and execution data, etc.

**Soft skills**:

* Strong learning agility; Ability to manage ambiguous environments, and to adapt to changing needs of the business; Good interpersonal and communication skills; strong presentation skills a must; Team player who is curious, dynamic, result oriented and can work collaboratively; Ability to think strategically in an ambiguous environment; Ability to operate effectively in an international matrix environment, with ability to work across time zones; Demonstrated leadership and management in driving innovation and automation leveraging advanced statistical and analytical techniques. Ability to prioritize and manage multiple projects in a fast\-paced environment.

**Technical skills**:

* Bachelor’s degree in Life Sciences, Pharmacy, Data Science, Computer Science, or a related field. A master’s degree is preferred.
* Over 7\+ years of direct experience in pharmaceutical sales data and data management, with expertise in syndicated data, Specialty Pharmacy, and digital/multi\-channel data.
* Proficient technical expertise in platforms and tools such as AWS, Snowflake, Databricks, SQL, Python, and Informatica.
* In\-depth understanding of pharmaceutical sales and marketing data sources, including IQVIA and Veeva.
* Strong knowledge of pharmaceutical sales operations and how data is applied within commercial operations.
* Proven ability to translate business requirements into actionable data solutions.
* Comprehensive understanding of data management principles and processes, including data governance and stewardship for maintaining data quality.
* Excellent communication skills, with the ability to simplify complex data management topics for non\-technical stakeholders.
* Experience with analytical tools such as Power BI, Qlik Sense, Tableau, Smartsheet, and Alteryx is highly desirable.
* Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite, including Excel, Word, and PowerPoint.
* Demonstrated aptitude for problem\-solving, strategic thinking, and ensuring high\-quality data outputs with robust quality assurance practices.
* Ability to distill complex information into actionable insights and clear recommendations.
* Proven ability to collaborate effectively across multiple levels of stakeholders and functions within the organization.
* Strong understanding of pharmaceutical development, manufacturing, supply chain, and marketing operations.
* Demonstrated leadership in driving innovation and automation through advanced statistical and analytical techniques.
* Exceptional decision\-making skills, including identifying key issues, developing effective solutions, and securing stakeholder buy\-in.
* Ability to foster collaboration across varying levels of management, roles, and functions

**Education**: Advanced degree in areas such as Management/Statistics/Decision Sciences/Engineering/Life Sciences/ Business Analytics or related field (e.g., PhD / MBA / Masters)

**Languages**: Excellent knowledge in English and strong communication skills – written and spoken


Pursue progress, discover extraordinary


Better is out there. Better medications, better outcomes, better science. But progress doesn’t happen without people – people from different backgrounds, in different locations, doing different roles, all united by one thing: a desire to make miracles happen. So, let’s be those people.

title: Director - Data & Digital
description:
### **Summary**

* Independently lead Data and digital and AI global initiatives part of the overall Enterprise and Divisional Data and digital Strategy to contribute solving unmet medical needs, in collaboration with various stakeholders.
* Role model a culture of analytical and data driven decision making and data/data sciences across Novartis leadership in research, development, commercial, manufacturing and support functions.
* Deep technical expertise with key accountability for a significant project, business activity.
* Shape future direction for own part of the organization based on the overall organization strategy provided by business leadership.
* Empowers the team and provides guidance and coaching


### **About the Role**

**Major accountabilities:**

* Develops and executes roadmap for the team to innovate in multiple business verticals by transforming the way to solve a problem using Effective data management, digital journey, Data Science and Artificial Intelligence.
* Strategically coordinates, prioritizes and efficiently allocates the team resources to critical initiatives: plans resources proactively, anticipates and actively manages change, sets stakeholder expectations as required, identifies operational risks and enables the team to drive issues to resolution, balances multiple priorities and minimizes surprise escalations
* Design, develop and deliver various data science\-based insights, outcomes and innovations (using mathematics, computer science, statistics, engineering, management science, technology, economics, etc.) and create “proof of concepts and blueprints” to drive faster, timely, highly precise, workable and proactive decision making based on data\-based insights and science and shape strategic glidepath of the company.
* Design, develop and deliver various master data, data governance, and data quality initiatives to drive the business priorities, scale foundational capabilities to support data science initiatives as well as the data\-driven decision making
* Key responsibilities may include (e.g.): Identification and sourcing of relevant internal and external data sources, ensuring right access, governance and quality of all types of data such as master, reference, transactional
* Selection of innovative methods including machine learning, deep learning, other cognitive computing methods and artificial intelligence
* Exploratory analytics to identify trends, patterns or process drivers
* Support of User Experience Design and development of advanced analytics products
* Collaborates with globally dispersed internal stakeholders, external partners and Institutions and cross\-functional teams to solve critical business problems, drive operational efficiencies and innovative approaches,
* Provides expert input into the strategy for their Business Partners
* Proactively evaluates the need for technology and novel scientific software, visualization tools and new approaches to computation to increase the efficiency and quality of the Novartis data sciences practices
* Provides agile consulting, guidance and non\-standard exploratory analysis for an unplanned urgent problem
* Acts as a catalyst for innovation in Data management, Data Science and AI
* Presents and publishes articles in conferences and academic institutions of repute and serves as an ambassador for promoting Novartis Data and Data Sciences brand
* May lead a Team / Function or in\-depth technical expertise in a scientific / technical field depending upon the career path (Manager/Individual contributor)
* Coaches and empowers junior Data professionals and Data Scientists across Novartis.
* Contribute to the development of Novartis data management and data science capabilities
* Reporting of technical complaints / adverse events / special case scenarios related to Novartis products within 24 hours of receipt
* Distribution of marketing samples (where applicable)
* Ensure a healthy and safe workplace by complying with Novartis HSE and ISEC standards, implementing measures, providing training and resources, supporting employee well\-being, investigating incidents, and collaborating with HSE teams to maintain a safe environment while adhering to quality, ethical, health, safety, and environmental requirements

**Key performance indicators:**

* Selection by program of recommended data management and data science strategy
* Achievement and governance endorsement of data management and advanced analytics program tollgates
* Successful implementation based on KPI’s and enterprise data management, advanced analytics program objectives

**Minimum requirement:** **Work experience:**

* 10\+ years of relevant experience in Data and digital in scientific fields of pharmaceutical development

**Language:**

* English

**Why Novartis:** Helping people with disease and their families takes more than innovative science. It takes a community of smart, passionate people like you. Collaborating, supporting and inspiring each other. Combining to achieve breakthroughs that change patients’ lives. Ready to create a brighter future together? https://www.novartis.com/about/strategy/people\-and\-culture

**Benefits and Rewards:** Read our handbook to learn about all the ways we’ll help you thrive personally and professionally: https://www.novartis.com/careers/benefits\-rewards

title: Lead Enterprise Architect - AI and Shared Orchestration, Director
description:
Join us as a Lead Enterprise Architect \- AI and Shared Orchestration

* We’ll look to you to define the strategic target architecture and roadmap, aligning them with business strategy and objectives
* You'll be facilitating collaborative architecture decision making, partnering and engaging with key business and digital leaders to continually evolve the bank’s long term architectural direction
* With valuable exposure, you’ll cultivate strong relationships and proactively engage with key stakeholders, including business and technology leaders, vendors and partners, and industry thought leaders
* We're offering this role at director level

**What you'll do**
------------------


As a Lead Enterprise Architect, you’ll architect customer centric, high performance, secure, robust and sustainable end to end digital products, solutions, and services that deliver business value while aligning to the bank’s strategic target architecture.


You’ll be actively contributing to the growth of architecting capability and the community across the bank through thought leadership, knowledge sharing, contributing to the community of practice, and building capability in others through coaching, mentoring and teaching.


As well as this, you’ll be:

* Leading architecture and design reviews of solution architectures within delivery programmes of high architectural significance or risk
* Inspecting and verifying that proposed designs meet business needs, and are compliant with Architecture Council approved architecture principles, standards, and patterns
* Driving technology innovation by identifying and evaluating emerging technologies and their potential impact on the bank
* Actively shaping and contributing to strategic investment programmes, identifying opportunities for simplification or reuse, and guiding programme design to build and adopt the key architecture enablers
* Promoting a DevOps mindset by working as part of development teams to embed architecture guidance in CI/CD pipelines
* Continuously researching and evaluating emerging technologies, architecture patterns, and industry best practices to identify threats to current architecture and opportunities for innovation and competitive advantage

**The skills you'll need**
--------------------------


To succeed in this role, you’ll need expert knowledge of enterprise architecture frameworks, modern technologies such as Cloud, microservices and AI, agile architecture and DevOps practices, including a deep understanding of business use cases and emerging trends that drive organisational success.


You’ll bring extensive experience of defining and developing strategic target architectures that align with organisational objectives. This will include experience of engaging with partners across the organisation to define architectures that deliver tangible business outcomes.


You’ll also demonstrate:

* Experience of leading collaborative decision\-making processes, partnering with senior business and technology colleagues to articulate and evolve architectural direction
* Experience of identifying and advocating for strategic investment opportunities that enhance the organisation's architecture goals
* The proven ability to craft compelling business cases and influence senior stakeholders to secure investment for architecture initiatives
* Extensive experience of overseeing and assuring the quality of architecture designs, with a focus on risk management and governance
* Experience of conducting comprehensive architecture and design reviews to validate that solutions meet business needs and comply with architecture standards
* A proven track record of fostering a culture of architectural excellence through mentorship and knowledge sharing

title: Associate Specialist Architect, AVP
description:
Join us as an Associate Specialist Architect

* We’ll look to you to support the design and implementation of architecture within a specialist domain such as Business, Infrastructure, Data, Security, AI, Integration, Channels or similar
* You’ll assist in solution design and participate in peer reviews to ensure adherence to architecture standards and best practices
* This is a chance to contribute to the development of architecture knowledge within the bank by sharing insights, participating in community initiatives, and mentoring junior team members as needed
* We're offering this role at associate vice president level

**What you'll do**
------------------


In this key role, you’ll assist in the realisation of the Enterprise and Solution Architectures working as part of development teams throughout the engineering development lifecycle. This includes providing technical guidance, resolving architectural impediments, and championing the adoption of architecture patterns and practices.


We’ll look to you to support Program Managers, Solution Architects, and Engineers in developing reusable and scalable capabilities within your specific domain, ensuring alignment with the bank’s strategic initiatives.


You’ll also:

* Support the development of architecture models within a specific domain, ensuring alignment with the bank’s Strategic Target Architecture
* Support the adoption of specialist domain architecture enablers, assisting in the creation of playbooks, collaborating with peers, and helping educate stakeholders on best practices and alignment with strategic roadmaps
* Maintain familiarity with and apply approved tools, models, reference architectures, and design patterns, providing guidance to development teams on best practices and suitable alternatives
* Engage in design reviews for projects, contributing to the assessment of solution quality, identifying potential risks, and communicating findings to relevant stakeholders for further action
* Keep abreast of emerging technologies within your domain, assessing potential opportunities or risks and contributing insights to the architecture governance framework to inform decision\-making

**The skills you'll need**
--------------------------


To excel in this role, you’ll need knowledge in area of specialism including good understanding of business use cases and emerging trends that drive organisational success. You’ll also have knowledge of modern technologies such as Cloud, Microservices, AI along with agile architecture and DevOps practices.


In addition, you’ll need:

* Experience of collaborative decision\-making processes, partnering with business and technology colleagues to articulate and evolve architectural direction, while ensuring adherence to key architecture principles and alignment with strategic goals
* Basic experience in creating business cases to influence senior stakeholders to secure investment for architecture initiatives
* Experience of participating in overseeing and assuring the quality of architecture designs including supporting Architecture and Design Reviews to validate that solutions meet business needs and comply with architecture standards, with a focus on risk management and governance

title: Platform Lead - AI and Shared Orchestration, Director
description:
Join us as a Platform Lead \- AI and Shared Orchestration

* We’re looking for an established leader to be accountable for all aspects of change, run and operational health of a given platform
* You’ll be involved in the design, architecture, build, test, implementation, risk, security, stability, resilience, simplification, efficiency, service management and life\-cycling of your platform
* Hone your existing skills and be part of an innovative and collaborative team culture
* We're offering this role at director level

**What you'll do**
------------------


In this high\-profile role, you’ll oversee your platform and own and create the platform technical road map with the right architecture, solutions and commercial value. We’ll look to you to manage the tensions inherent in working through the implementation of competing customer priorities with the right business leaders and business product owners. You’ll also play an integral part in managing your platform’s risk culture, making sure that risks are discussed and understood at every step.


You’ll also be:

* Optimising the scheduling and sequencing of initiatives and achieving agreed targets for the cycle time, risk and cost profiles of your platform
* Delivering, owning and maintaining the platform operational stability and performance of technology, including the maintenance of any applications, systems, utilities and tools
* Making sure that business solutions are optimal to customer needs and the overall technology strategy and roadmap
* Owning the financial, commercial and flow performance of the platform and proactively tracking, reporting and acting to drive the improvements
* Delivering regulatory reporting and managing the relevant budgets provided

**The skills you'll need**
--------------------------


We’re looking for someone with in\-depth domain or platform product knowledge, experience and expertise, coupled with a strong commercial acumen and good collaboration and stakeholder management skills. In addition, you’ll need business and systems analytical skills, and a strong understanding of platform applications and services, with the ability to convert a business ask to a technical solution.


You’ll also be expected to have:

* Operational, risk management, financial management, collaboration and negotiation experience and expertise
* Strong leadership skills, including Agile and servant leadership experience
* Architecture, design and engineering skills
* An expert understanding of running large complex projects spanning multiple teams and senior governance forums

title: Software Engineer, AVP
description:
Join us as a Software Engineer

* This is an opportunity for a driven Software Engineer to take on an exciting new career challenge
* Day\-to\-day, you'll build a wide network of stakeholders of varying levels of seniority
* It’s a chance to hone your existing technical skills and advance your career
* We're offering this role at associate vice president level

**What you'll do**
------------------


In your new role, you’ll engineer and maintain innovative, customer centric, high performance, secure and robust solutions. You’ll be working within a feature team and using your extensive experience to engineer software, scripts and tools that are often complex, as well as liaising with other engineers, architects and business analysts across the platform.


You’ll also be:

* Producing complex and critical software rapidly and of high quality which adds value to the business
* Working in permanent teams who are responsible for the full life cycle, from initial development, through enhancement and maintenance to replacement or decommissioning
* Collaborating to optimise our software engineering capability
* Designing, producing, testing and implementing our working code
* Working across the life cycle, from requirements analysis and design, through coding to testing, deployment and operations

**The skills you'll need**
--------------------------


You’ll need a background in software engineering, software design, architecture, and an understanding of how your area of expertise supports our customers.


You’ll also need:

* At least eight years of experience in cloud operations and application support, with a strong focus on AWS
* Hands\-on experience with AWS services such as EC2, S3, DynamoDB, Lambda, CloudWatch, IAM, and VPC
* A solid understanding of Incident and Problem Management processe
* Proficiency in CI/CD pipelines and infrastructure automation using Terraform or CloudFormation
* Experience in multiple programming languages or low code toolsets
* Experience of DevOps, Testing and Agile methodology and associated toolsets
company_description: We champion potential.

title: Enterprise Architect, VP
description:
Join us as an Enterprise Architect

* We’ll look to you to support the definition, development and implantation of the strategic target architecture and roadmap, aligning them with business strategy and objectives through collaboration, stakeholder engagement, and adherence to governance standards
* You'll be providing technical guidance, resolving architectural impediments, and championing the adoption of architecture patterns and practices
* With valuable exposure, you’ll cultivate and maintain strong relationships with key stakeholders, including business leaders, technology teams, and external partners, to enhance understanding and support for the strategic target architecture
* We're offering this role at vice president level

**What you'll do**
------------------


As a Lead Enterprise Architect, you’ll support the architecting of customer centric, high performance, secure, robust and sustainable end to end digital products, solutions, and services that deliver business value while aligning to the bank’s strategic target architecture.


You’ll be supporting the development of architecture capability by proactively building personal capability and sharing knowledge, best practices, lessons learned, and participating in communities of practice.


As well as this, you’ll be:

* Participating in architecture and design reviews of solution architectures, while adhering to approved architecture standards and principles
* Contributing to shaping and identifying opportunities for simplification and reuse within strategic investment programmes
* Collaborating with business and digital leaders to evolve architectural direction, ensuring that decisions and designs are documented in accordance with organisational standards
* Keeping up\-to\-date with emerging technologies, identifying potential opportunities and threats and raising them with the Architecture Council for further evaluation
* Promoting DevOps practices by working as part of development teams to embed architecture guidance in CI/CD pipelines

**The skills you'll need**
--------------------------


To succeed in this role, you’ll need extensive knowledge of enterprise architecture frameworks, modern technologies such as Cloud, microservices and AI, agile architecture and DevOps practices, including a deep understanding of business use cases and emerging trends that drive organisational success.


You’ll bring experience of defining and developing strategic target architectures that align with organisational objectives. This will include experience of engaging with partners across the organisation to define architectures that deliver tangible business outcomes.


You’ll also demonstrate experience of:

* Collaborative decision\-making processes, partnering with business and technology colleagues to articulate and evolve architectural direction
* Creating business cases to influence senior stakeholders to secure investment for architecture initiatives
* Overseeing and assuring the quality of architecture designs, with a focus on risk management and governance
* Participating in architecture and design reviews to validate that solutions meet business needs and comply with architecture standards
* Proven people capability development, including mentoring, supporting professional development, encouraging knowledge sharing across architecture teams and promoting best practices
company_description: We champion potential.

title: People Analytics Specialist
description:
**Description**


**The opportunity:**

  

We are seeking a highly skilled and dynamic People Analytics Specialist to join our team at a senior level. The ideal  

candidate will have advanced analytical and technical expertise in building dashboards and reports, leveraging  

various data sources such as EDP, data lakes, and APIs for systems like Workday. This role requires strong  

experience in Power BI, proficiency in Python for building predictive models, and a solid understanding of HR  

analytics to deliver actionable insights. Additionally, the candidate must excel in project management and stakeholder  

management.

 **How you’ll make an impact:**

  

* Design and develop advanced dashboards and visualizations using Power BI and other analytics tools.
* Integrate data from various sources (EDP, data lakes, APIs, Workday) for seamless reporting.
* Use Python to create predictive models for employee insights and workforce planning.
* Collaborate with stakeholders to gather requirements and deliver impactful analytics solutions.
* Manage projects effectively, ensuring timely delivery of analytics initiatives.
* Communicate insights and recommendations clearly to both technical and non\-technical audiences.
* Demonstrate strong stakeholder management skills to build and maintain effective relationships.
* Support day\-to\-day standard and ad\-hoc Workday reports for stakeholders globally.
* Responsible for ensuring compliance with applicable external and internal regulations, procedures, and guidelines.
* Living Hitachi Energy’s core values safety and integrity, which means taking responsibility for your own actions while caring for your colleagues and the business.

 **Your Background:**

  

* Qualification of bachelor’s or master’s degree preferred.
* Experience of 5 – 8 years into Project \& stakeholder management.
* Proven experience in Power BI, EDP, and data lake integrations.
* Proficiency in Python for advanced analytics and predictive modeling.
* Strong stakeholder management and presentation skills.
* Prior experience in core analytics is a must; HR analytics is an advantage.
* Proficiency in both spoken \& written English language is required.

**Qualified individuals with a disability may request a reasonable accommodation if you are unable or limited in your ability to use or access the Hitachi Energy career site as a result of your disability. You may request reasonable accommodations by completing a** **general inquiry form** **on our website. Please include your contact information and specific details about your required accommodation to support you during the job application process.**
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

**This is solely for job seekers with disabilities requiring accessibility assistance or an accommodation in the job application process. Messages left for other purposes will not receive a response.**

title: Senior DevOps Engineer
description:
**Designation:** Sr. DevOps Engineer
**Experience:** 4\+years
**Work Mode: WFH** Night shift (9PM \- 6AM)
**Industry Type :** IT Services **Job Description:**  

Invimatic is looking for enthusiastic Devops Engineer. Responsible for our infrastructure team,building
scalable infrastructure and supporting the development teams.  

  

* Implementing continuous integration \& continuous delivery strategies.
* Identify automation opportunities, design, build, and deploy best DevOps practices in an agile way

of working.
* Design and maintain complex Jenkins build pipelines for automatic testing and deployment to catch

bugs, performance regressions, stability issues.
* Optimize build pipelines for server utilization
* Design, create and maintain Docker containers
* Advise and fix issues in Gradle configurations
* Support development team members across the locations on build and environment issues.
* Provide overall direction and take responsibility of smooth and efficient operations helping in

increasing development productivity
* Understanding of secure coding principles and best practices (e.g., OWASP Top 10 vulnerabilities,

secure authentication, input validation, Secure coding, code review etc.).  

  

**Requirements \- Skills \& qualifications:*** AWS \- AWS Lambda, S3, S3 Parquet
* AWS Migration exposure
* API developement experience
* DevOps: Strong knowledge of DevOps tools and practices that promote shorter lead times, fast

feedback, and high quality. Example: Git, trunk\-based development, CI/CD pipeline, release
engineering.
* Strong engineering mindset. Ability and willingness to work across various Cloud

Architecture / SysOps / DevOps initiatives. Ability to deal with ambiguity.
* Excellent Communication skills
* Ensure secure handling of client and business data in line with **ISO 27001** requirements.

title: Senior DevOps Engineer
description:
### **Senior / Lead DevOps Engineer (Contract – 6 Months)**

### **About the Company \& Client**


This role is part of a **large\-scale digital transformation program** delivered by **Xenon7**, in partnership with **one of Egypt’s leading banks**.


Xenon7 works closely with top\-tier banks and enterprises to modernize technology platforms, enhance system reliability, and elevate digital capabilities. The selected candidate will join a **mission\-critical banking environment**, operating at enterprise scale and within regulated frameworks.

### **Engagement Details**

* **Client:** Leading bank (banking / fintech domain)
* **Contract duration:** 6 months
* **Working hours:** 8 hours per day, 5 days per week
* **Engagement type:** Contractor
* **Compensation:** Hourly rate, **calculated and paid on a monthly basis**

### **Role Overview**


We are seeking a **Senior or Lead DevOps Engineer** to support and evolve the bank’s DevOps and platform capabilities. The role requires strong hands\-on expertise, ownership mindset, and prior experience working in **banking or fintech environments**.

### **Technical Environment**

* Azure DevOps \& CI/CD pipelines
* Kubernetes / OpenShift
* GitOps using ArgoCD
* Helm
* Monitoring \& observability with Grafana and Prometheus
* Logging stack (EFK – Elasticsearch, Fluentd, Kibana)

### **Requirements**

* 5\+ years of experience in DevOps
* **Previous experience in banking or fintech environments (mandatory)**
* Strong hands\-on expertise with Kubernetes and OpenShift
* Proven experience designing and maintaining CI/CD pipelines
* Practical experience with GitOps and ArgoCD
* Solid understanding of monitoring, observability, and logging in production systems
* Ability to work independently and take ownership in enterprise environments

title: DevOps Security Engineer
description:
Location:
Bengaluru, KA, IN
Company: ExxonMobil  

**About us**

  


At ExxonMobil, our vision is to lead in energy innovations that advance modern living and a net\-zero future. As one of the world’s largest publicly traded energy and chemical companies, we are powered by a unique and diverse workforce fueled by the pride in what we do and what we stand for.

  


The success of our Upstream, Product Solutions and Low Carbon Solutions businesses is the result of the talent, curiosity and drive of our people. They bring solutions every day to optimize our strategy in energy, chemicals, lubricants and lower\-emissions technologies.

  


We invite you to bring your ideas to ExxonMobil to help create sustainable solutions that improve quality of life and meet society’s evolving needs. Learn more about **our What and our Why** and how we canwork **together**.


**What role you will play in our team**
---------------------------------------

  




The DevOps Security Engineer, will work within a globally dispersed corporate information security team where you will be responsible for building, maintaining, and deploying cloud infrastructure and CI/CD pipelines that support CyberArk’s Privileged Cloud and Secrets Manager offerings. Your work will directly impact product velocity, quality, and security.

**What you will do**
--------------------

  




* Design and manage secure DevOps configuration management and CI/CD services (build, packaging, deployment).
* Harden cloud and on\-prem environments (AWS, Azure, GCP) and manage secrets using tools like CyberArk Privileged Cloud or CyberArk Secrets Manager.
* Build and maintain cloud deployment infrastructure and artifacts.
* Evaluate and adopt new technologies to improve pipelines and product quality.
* Own the full lifecycle from development environments to production systems on AWS.
* Automate deployments using modern configuration and deployment management systems.
* Monitor logs and alerts for suspicious activity, respond to security incidents, and conduct forensic analysis
* Maintain security documentation and provide training to development and operations teams on secure coding and DevSecOps practices.
**About you**
-------------

  

**Skills and Qualifications**

  


* Bachelor’s degree in computer science or equivalent
* 3\+ years of experience as a DevOps engineer with hands\-on cloud development and deployment
* Cloud Platforms: AWS, Azure
* CI/CD Tools: Git, GitHub, Jenkins
* IaC \& Configuration Management: Terraform, Ansible
* Operating Systems: Windows and Linux/Unix administration
* Networking: Cloud networking and topology management
* Programming \& Scripting: Python, Groovy, Bash
* Containers \& Orchestration: Docker, ECS
* Monitoring \& Alerts: Experience with alerting and monitoring systems
* Observability \& Logging: DataDog (preferred),
* Testing: Unit, integration, and system testing methodologies
* Security Integration: DevSecOps, secrets management, secure deployment practices

  

**Preferred Qualifications/ Experience**

  


* Experience with full application release cycles and secure deployment practices
* Familiarity with Agile development methodologies
* Strong understanding of cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, GCP) and container orchestration (Docker, Kubernetes).
* Strong analytical and problem\-solving abilities
* Creative troubleshooting and out\-of\-the\-box thinking
* Team player with excellent communication skills
* Decision\-making with architectural and business awareness
* Passion for continuous learning and staying current with cybersecurity trends.
* Fluent in English with strong writing skills
**Your benefits**
-----------------

  


An ExxonMobil career is one designed to last. Our commitment to you runs deep our employees grow personally and professionally, with benefits built on our core categories of health, security, finance and life. We offer you:

  


* Competitive compensation
* Medical plans, maternity leave and benefits, life, accidental death and dismemberment benefits
* Retirement benefits
* Global networking \& cross\-functional opportunities
* Annual vacations \& holidays
* Day care assistance program
* Training and development program
* Tuition assistance program
* Workplace flexibility policy
* Relocation program
* Transportation facility

  



Please note benefits may change from time to time without notice, subject to applicable laws. The benefits programs are based on the Company’s eligibility guidelines.

**Stay connected with us**
--------------------------

  

* Learn more about ExxonMobil in India, visit **ExxonMobil India** and **Energy Factor India****.**
* Follow us on **LinkedIn** and **ExxonMobil (@exxonmobil) • Instagram photos and videos**
* Like us on **Facebook**
* Subscribe our channel at **YouTube**
**EEO Statement**
-----------------

  


ExxonMobil is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, national origin or disability status.

**Business solicitation and recruiting scams**
----------------------------------------------

  


ExxonMobil does not use recruiting or placement agencies that charge candidates an advance fee of any kind (e.g., placement fees, immigration processing fees, etc.). Follow the LINK to understand more about recruitment scams in the name of ExxonMobil.

  



Nothing herein is intended to override the corporate separateness of local entities. Working relationships discussed herein do not necessarily represent a reporting connection, but may reflect a functional guidance, stewardship, or service relationship.

  



Exxon Mobil Corporation has numerous affiliates, many with names that include ExxonMobil, Exxon, Esso and Mobil. For convenience and simplicity, those terms and terms like corporation, company, our, we and its are sometimes used as abbreviated references to specific affiliates or affiliate groups. Abbreviated references describing global or regional operational organizations and global or regional business lines are also sometimes used for convenience and simplicity. Similarly, ExxonMobil has business relationships with thousands of customers, suppliers, governments, and others. For convenience and simplicity, words like venture, joint venture, partnership, co\-venturer, and partner are used to indicate business relationships involving common activities and interests, and those words may not indicate precise legal relationships.

  

  

**Job Segment:** Sustainability, Linux, Unix, Engineer, Computer Science, Energy, Technology, Engineering
